row.entry: This modules implements another approach to compress the tonal range of HDR input images into the limited tonal range of a typical LDR output file. It offers several implementations of global tonemap operators.

sect4.title: Usage
sect4.para: Global tonemapping processes each pixel of an HDR image without taking the local surrounding into account. This is generally faster than local tonemapping as implemented in module tonemapping but might lead to less convincing results with very high dynamic scenes. As an enhancement to the original operators, darktable's implementation allows to preserve detail of the input image and transfer it back into the output image.

sect5.title: operator
sect5.para: Reinhard, Filmic and Drago global tonemap operators are available for use. Depending on the selected operator different parameters can be adjusted. Some operators are fully self-adjusting and do not require specific controls.

sect5.title: bias
sect5.para: Only offered for operator Drago. This parameter influences the contrast of your output image. It is an essential parameter for adjusting the compression of high values and the visibility of details in dark areas. According to the original paper a value of 0.85 is recommended as a starting point.

sect5.title: target
sect5.para: Only offered for operator Drago. This is a scale factor to adjust global image brightness to the brightness of the intended display. It is measured in cd/m2 and should match the according value of your output device. Higher values lead to a brighter, while lower values lead to a darker image.

sect5.title: detail
sect5.para: Offered as an addition to all operators. This parameter controls how much detail is preserved and transfered back into the output image after tonemapping.
